markdownRemark.html:
There are generally two ways how to define a path from which we import elements to our files.

Relative imports

Absolute imports

Imagine a file structure like this:

- src
   - components
       - Button.js
       - Header.js
       - Form.js
   - features
       - Input.js

In order to import Button.js to our Input.js, we could do the following:

A) import using the Relative path.

Relative path is always... well... relative :) to the file in which we currently are, in our case Input.js. In order to import to Button.js to our Input.js, we will need to go firstly one directory up "../" and then to the directory features

import { Button } from "../features/Button.js"

B) import using the Absolute path.

Absolute path is always fixed from src folder.

import { Button } from "features/Button.js"

In order to make the absolute path work in the create-react-app we will need to go to package.json and in the scripts section, we will need to add NODE_PATH=src to each script which is executing the code:

"scripts": {
    "start":"NODE_PATH=src react-scripts start",
    "build":"NODE_PATH=src react-scripts build",
    "test":"NODE_PATH=src react-scripts test --env=jsdom",
}
